div.div: ἔπειτα (ἐπί, εἶτα): thereupon, then, in that case; of time or of sequence, often correl. to πρῶτον, Il. 6.260; and joined with αὐτίκα, αἶψα, ὦκα, also ἔνθα δ᾽ ἔπειτα, Il. 18.450; referring back to what has been stated (or implied), ‘so then,’ ‘accordingly,’ ‘after all,’ Od. 1.65, 106, Od. 3.62; after a part., Il. 14.223, Il. 11.730; freq. introducing - an apodosis emphatically, ‘in that case,’ Od. 1.84, and after temporal clauses, esp. δὴ ἔπειτα, Od. 8.378; τότ᾽ ἔπειτα.
From A Homeric Dictionary (Georg Autenrieth, New York, Harper and Brothers, 1891)
